==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=无}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etyl}}
{{Han simp|舞|f=舛|t=灬}} – removal of {{zh-l|*舛}} (character used for sound). (Compare {{zh-l|*可}} from {{zh-l|*奇}}.)

In the source character {{och-l|舞|dance}}, top component graphically originally a figure with outstretched arms holding two animal hides: {{zh-l|*革}} + {{zh-l|*大}} + {{zh-l|*革}}.

===Etymology 1===
Core Sino–Tibetan. From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*ma||no, not}}; cognate with {{cog|bo|མ||not}} and {{cog|my|မ||not}}.

Cognate with:

* {{och-l|微|not, no}}
* {{och-l|毋|do not}}
* {{och-l|勿|not, don't}}
* {{och-l|未|not yet, haven't}}
* {{och-l|靡|not, no}}
* {{och-l|亡|not have; to flee, to disappear, to die}}
* {{och-l|沒|to end, to disappear, to drown}}
* {{och-l|莫|none, nobody, nothing; do not; can not}}

Attested profusely in Classical Chinese, this word is the prototypical negation particle in the *''m-'' series of Chinese negatives. In the [[oracle bone script]], however, {{lang|zh|無}} is not frequently used, and its homophone (or near-homophone) {{och-l|毋}} is used instead.

See {{och-l|不|not}} for more on negative particles in Old Chinese.

====Definitions====
{{zh-hanzi}}

# {{lb|zh|literary|Hakka|or|Min}} to [[not]] [[have]] something; [[there]] is not ...
#: {{zh-x|天空 無 雲。|There is no cloud in the sky.}}
#: {{zh-x|我 無 零星錢。|I '''don't have''' any change.|MN}}
# {{lb|zh|literary|Min}} {{n-g|Negation particle preceding verbs and adjectives.}} [[not]]
#: {{zh-x|無可|can't}}
#: {{zh-x|我 無 求 於 你。|I want nothing from you.}}
# {{lb|zh|literary|Min}} [[have]] [[not]]
#: {{zh-x|我 無 共 伊 講。|I '''didn't''' tell him.|MN}}
# {{lb|zh|literary|Hakka|or|Min}} {{n-g|Interrogative particle.}}
# {{lb|zh|Hakka|Min}} [[if]] [[not]]; [[otherwise]] {{gloss|placed at the start of a sentence}}
# {{†}} [[regardless]] of, [[no matter]] whether
# {{†}} [[nothing]], [[nil]]
#: {{zh-x|從.無.到.有|start from nothing, from scratch}}
# {{†}} {{zh-alt-form|毋|do not}}
# [[without]], [[-less]], [[un-]]
#: {{zh-x|無情|heartless}}
#: {{zh-x|無理|unreasonable}}
#: {{zh-x|無邊|unlimited}}
